docs.snippet: Aly Raisman and Gabby Douglas defied the odds on Sunday to qualify for another Olympics, but each member of the U.S. women’s gymnastics team had her own reasons for feeling emotional....
docs.lead_paragraph: Aly Raisman and Gabby Douglas defied the odds on Sunday to qualify for another Olympics, but each member of the U.S. women’s gymnastics team had her own reasons for feeling emotional.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of the Times column describes intensity of emotions at United States Olympic women's gymnastics trials, where women's national team coordinator Martha Karolyi chose five women who will represent US in Rio Games.

headline.main: Flying High, Above and Beyond the Routine
headline.print_headline: Flying High, Above and Beyond the Routine

docs.snippet: Tony Gwynn will be on everybody's mind during All-Star Game festivities, perhaps no more poignantly than how his death affected American League starter Chris Sale of the Chicago White Sox....

headline.main: Sale Says Gwynn's Death Caused Him to Quit Chewing Tobacco
headline.print_headline: Sale Says Gwynn's Death Caused Him to Quit Chewing Tobacco

docs.snippet: Tronc, the rebranded Tribune Publishing, wants to offer 2,000 videos a day, up from about 200 now, and hands-off video production is central to that aim....
docs.lead_paragraph: Tronc, the rebranded Tribune Publishing, wants to offer 2,000 videos a day, up from about 200 now, and hands-off video production is central to that aim.
docs.abstract: Tronc, newspaper and magazine publishing company formerly known as Tribune Publishing, is seeking to increase its output of videos from couple hundred a day to 2,000 daily; is using automated video production technology, currently offered by companies Wochit and Wibbitz, to achieve that aim.

headline.main: As Online Video Surges, Publishers Turn to Automation
headline.print_headline: As Online Video Gains Ground, Publishers Seek Automation to Expand Output
